results.title: At the foot of Mt Fuji
results.brief_description: A day in the life of a ten year old child who lives in a small town at the base of Mt Fuji in Japan, is revealed in his letter to a pen pal in the United States. Suitable for Early-Middle Primary students. No other credits available.

Birdlife on Townsville Common, showing the osprey, kite, plover, jabiru stork, egret, spoonbill, and heron. Concentrates on the Australian crane, the brolga and in particular its courtship dance,

results.title: At the dentist's
results.brief_description: Shows a dentist treating a young child for a routine filling. Provides a clear step by step illustration of each of the procedures carried out and the reasons for these. Also makes effective use of diagrams.

results.title: At the crossroads: the story of America's endangered species
results.creator_credit: Stouffer Productions, Mark Stouffer and Marty Stouffer
results.brief_description: Much of America’s wildlife is now endangered because of hunting, trapping, poisoning, habitat destruction and environmental pollution. America’s extinct mammals and birds include the Gull Island Vole, the Plains Wolf, the Sea Mink, the Labrador Duck and the Great Auk. the Whooping Crane are a dramatic example of an endangered species which came back form the brink of extinction. A simple alternative is offered and some important reasons why these endangered species are vitally important to all life on Earth are presented. Includes footage of the Ivory-billed Woodpecker which was last filmed in 1935 and is probably now extinct. Narrated by Barton Heyman.

results.title: At the circus
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Mervyn LeRoy and Edward Buzzell
results.brief_description: A shyster lawyer and two incompetents save a circus from bankruptcy while a man-eating gorilla and the combined unmistakable talents of a tattooed lady and a crazy musical conductor move the plot foward at a furious pace. Blending all that is ridiculous and crazy this movie is one of the Marx Bros classics. Cast also includes Eve Arden, Margaret Dumont, Nat Pendleton, Fritz Feld.

results.title: At the caribou crossing place. Pt. 2
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Education Development Center, Quentin Brown and Kevin Smith
results.brief_description: Part of a series on the Netsilik Inuit as documented by the Education Development Center. In this part, two men join the four people at camp. The men build a row of inukshuit, manlike figures which they use to deflect the oncoming caribou into the water, where they are subsequently speared and floated ashore. A great feast follows.

results.title: At the caribou crossing place. Pt. 1
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Education Development Center, Quentin Brown and Kevin Smith
results.brief_description: Part of a series on the Netsilik Inuit as documented by the Education Development Center. In this part, the time is early autumn the place an Inuit camp in the Pelly Bay region of the Canadian Arctic. A woman, a boy and two men are shown occupied with their various activities. A woman works on caribou skins. Men return from the hunt with another caribou. A boy picks berries and then plays at being a hunter.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Education Development Center, Quentin Brown and Kevin Smith

results.title: At the canoe camp
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Ian Dunlop and Philip Robertson
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Narritjin Maymuru (A)”.
Narritjin Maymuru is leader of the Manggalili clan of northeast Arnhem Land. Covers the daily life of Narritjin and his family at a camp in the bush. Shows the making of dug out canoes. Photography by Dean Semler.

results.title: At the brink
results.creator_credit: Central Independent Television (UK), WGBH (Boston), Nihon Hoso Kyokai and Peter Raymont
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Nuclear age”.
In an exclusive interview, former Soviet Foreign Minister Andrei Gromyko speaks for the first time about his famous White House Meeting with President Kennedy at the height of the Cuban Missile Crisis, and refutes certain claims made at the time. “…Kennedy never raised the question of the presence of Soviet missiles in Cuba. I repeat, he never mentioned it.” The statesman recalled that the discussions were “full of sharp turns.” For the first time since the end of the Second World War, the Cuban Missile crisis brought the world to the brink of a Nuclear war.

results.title: At the borders of the future. [No. 70/17] = Aux frontieres de l'avenir
results.creator_credit: Office de Documentation par Film and Nicolas Skrotsky
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items including: 1. Better building - to build better and cheaper accommodation new techniques are being used but care must be taken to maintain quality. 2. The solar observatory. 3. The artificial kidney - Professor Jungers speaks about the importance of a dialyser or artificial kidney.
